Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations|plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
= action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= causative process by which a deity causes events to increase in intensity
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans openly express recognition of what someone else has done or achieved
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be high|to become high|to mount up
Node.definition: = process by which objects reach a relatively high elevation above the earth
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

Node.gloss: to keep alive|to restore to life
Node.definition: = to cause an object to become or remain alive and well; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in most cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand > to lift a hand (to do something)
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (to do something); hence: = action by which humans take a conscious decision to perform a certain event
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to bring to end successfully|to fulfill (one's) purpose
Node.definition: = causative action by which a deity brings an event related to someone else to a succesful end

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of
Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
